channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #152
item.content:encoded:
#152 - jan 3rd 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Cryptaris mission
A US army website heavy in 3d graphics. Is it now how they recruit?

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Sameroom
Connect different chat services together.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Http
A fast Ruby HTTP client with a chainable API, streaming support, and timeouts.
TTY::Prompt
Provides a number of prompt types for gathering user input and robust API for getting and validating complex inputs.
React-boilerplate
Quick setup for Redux, hot–reloading, PostCSS, react-router, ServiceWorker, AppCache, FontFaceObserver and Mocha.
SQL Tabs
An open source SQL console for Postgresql.
GitHub Hovercard
Hover popup for github issues, users, and repos.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
ApplicationRecord in Rails 5 dec 28
Rails 5 beta-1 was recently released and one of the notable change was introduction of ApplicationRecord.
A Retrospective on Ruby in 2015 dec 28
2015 is a big year for Ruby, let's look at some major changes.
How HTTP headers get passed from nginx to your Ruby app dec 28
HTTP headers contain cookies, information about the user agent, caching info — a whole lot of really useful stuff.
Third way to use block argument dec 28
There are two common ways to use block argument in a method. And a third one.
Using RSpec Metadata dec 29
Use rspec's metadata tag to separate the boilerplate of test setup.
What’s in a State and How to Persist It dec 29
Keeping all state in a webapp without depending on the server always being available.
Should I use a video as a background dec 29
What part of it is a trend and what is not.

item.title: Green Ruby News #151
item.content:encoded:
#151 - dec 27th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Benjamin Guedj portfolio
A french designer fullpage portfolio, very graphic.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Expressive CSS
An approach to writing lightweight, scalable CSS.
CSS Cursor
This small web app helps you to choose cursor type from the showcase for use in your application.
SlackArchive.io
Public chat archive for Slack.
dbHero
GUI for PostgreSQL & MySQL.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.0 Released dec 25
Bunch of new features in that new release. Happy Christmas.
Terminal-table
Ruby ASCII Table Generator, simple and feature rich.
Diffy
Easy Diffing in Ruby.
Pester
Automatically ask for a PR review on slack.
Services
A nifty service layer for your Rails app.
Debt_ceiling
Get a grip on your technical debt.
Fastgem
Command line color tool for search Ruby Gem faster
Homebrew-cask
A CLI for the administration of Mac applications. Not new, but now it is included in Homebrew. Update yours.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
The long, incredibly tortuous, and fascinating process of creating a Chinese font dec 18
Just you try designing 13,000-plus intricate character shapes that all have to balance one another.
How does ARGV get set in Ruby? dec 21
Understand how ARGV works by jumping into MRI code.
Composing Microscopic Rails Views With Cells dec 22
How to use the Cells gem for powerful encapsulation.
Multiline strings in Ruby 2.3.0 dec 22
Space indent when using heredoc can be used without breaking code's indentation in Ruby 2.3.0.
When to choose Elixir over Ruby for 2016 projects? dec 22
What are the criteria that may push you to use Elixir.
DHH - Building Basecamp 3 like a Porsche 911 dec 22
(podcast) in-depth talk about basecamp 3.
The joy of a collaborative writing process dec 22
There is so much value in active collaboration and the internet needs more of that.
Email confirmation with Clearance dec 23
How to use clearance gem for email confirmations.
Upgrading to Ruby on Rails 5.0 from Rails 4.2 dec 24
If you have a decent code coverage level and you know what you’re doing, upgrade should not be a big problem.
How Ruby 2.2 can cause an out-of-memory server crash dec 24
Some examples and patch for ruby 2.2's memory manage issue.
Ruby 2.0 keyword arguments and hook messages dec 26
A pretty neat pattern called hook messages.
flex-grow is weird. Or is it? dec 26
How flex-grow works, weird quirks and all.
Switching from rbenv to postmodern’s ruby-install and chruby dec 27
Switch over from rvm and rbenv to ruby-install and chruby.
ApplicationRecord in Rails 5 dec 28
Rails 5 beta-1 was recently released and one of the notable change was introduction of ApplicationRecord.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Controller Testing with Ruby (12m) dec 22
How to write controller specs and isolate them from other parts of your application with the help of mocks and stubs.

item.title: Green Ruby News #150
item.content:encoded:
#150 - dec 20th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bonne Marque
Very animated and inteactive agency website.
Domino
A 3d board, put dominoes, make them fall. Neat tree.js demo.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Fieldbook
Online database with a spreadsheet UI and a REST API.
The Bash Academy
Online learning for bash shell programming.
GitHub does dotfiles
unofficial guide to dotfiles on GitHub.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2.4 dec 16
This is mostly a security release but it also has some bugfixes.
Rails 5.0.0 beta1 dec 18
The first beta for Rails 5. Feel adventurous? Go try that!
strong_migrations
Catch unsafe migrations at dev time by raising errors with explicit message.
Kinto
Lightweight JSON storage service with synchronization and sharing abilities (self-hosted).
PouchDB
JavaScript database inspired by CouchDB that is designed to run well within the browser.
Slush
Tool to help generate new project structures.
Vuvuzela
Private messaging system that hides metadata.
Git-appraise
Distributed code review system for Git repos.
Containerd
A daemon to control runC, built for performance and density.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby Refinements dec 13
Using refinements to avoid monkey patching.
How to Test Multithreaded Code dec 14
By using Mutex and ConditionVariable.
Getting started with Distributed Ruby (DRb) dec 14
dRuby allows multiple Ruby processes to talk to each other with simple setup.
How to Test Multithreaded Code dec 14
Multithreaded code is hard to write and even harder to test.
Rails, Secure Cookies, HSTS and friends dec 14
How secure cookies and HTTP Strict Transport Security work in Rails by taking a look in its middleware stack.
SVG icons are easy but the fallbacks aren't dec 14
SVG fallbacks for the 4% of browsers that don't support SVG. As it turns out, that's hard.
Handling Paginated Resources in Ruby dec 15
Using 'recursive each' and Kernel#to_enum method to enumerate paginated resources
Refactor Until You Feel Almost Comfortable dec 15
How much is too much refactoring?
Working with Fractions and Rationals in Ruby dec 15
The rationality of Ruby mathematics.
New features in Express.js 4.0 dec 15
List of recently released features in Express.js.
Why I'm not using your open source project dec 15
Some good insight on what an open source project needs to enforce trust.
Iterating in Puppet dec 16
Various ways to iterate in puppet, including the most recent ones from puppet 4.
Max out Your TDD with Maxitest and Minitest dec 17
Maxitest makes tests a bit more readable and easier to use.
Email address validation and encodings dec 20
Various considerations for when you have to validate email addresses.

item.title: Green Ruby News #149
item.content:encoded:
#149 - dec 14th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Best Visualizations 2015
The best and brightest of the data viz world in 2015.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Cloudcraft
Visualize your cloud architecture like a pro.
You-Dont-Need-jQuery
Examples of how to do query, style, dom, ajax, event etc like jQuery with plain javascript.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
grape
An opinionated micro-framework for creating REST-like APIs in Ruby.
dry-validation
Data validation library based on predicate logic and rule composition
Toshi
A full bitcoin node for building web applications.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Choosing an HTTP Status Code — Stop Making It Hard dec 4
Use right HTTP status code when design APIs.
What's new in Ruby 2.3? dec 7
Frozen strings, dig for Hash and Array, did_you_mean... and many more others.
iOS and Android Programming with Go dec 8
Possibilities for native iOS and Android programming with Go.
Data Migrations in Rails dec 8
Use temp rake task instead of rails database migration as data migration.
Level Up Your Command-Line-Fu With Ruby dec 8
Using ruby as a swiss army knife to improve some comand-line tasks.
Ex Pusher Lite - Part 1: Phoenix Channels and Rails apps dec 9
Part 1 of a series which moves rails app to phoenix.
25,000+ Req/s for Rack JSON API with MRuby dec 9
Performance comparison for a simple rack app between MRI ruby and mruby.
Speeding Up Bulk Imports in Rails dec 9
Direct SQL calls is more efficient when dealing with buld imports.
Rails Anti-Pattern: Fat Decorator dec 9
Make single decoretor less envy by separate concerns into small decorators.
Using Multi-Step Animations and Transitions dec 11
Multi-step animations and transitions are fun little tricks we have at our disposal to create rich, dynamic movement in CSS.
How to Spice up Your Slack Channel with Hubot dec 11
Integrate Hubot to Slack in many ways.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
DockerCon EU 2015 dec 8
DockerCon EU 2015 all presentations.

item.title: Green Ruby News #148
item.content:encoded:
#148 - dec 6th 2015

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Developing Games With Ruby
(book) can also be read online for free.
Elixir School
Lessons in the fundamentals of elixir.
WorkDifferent
Publication and job board that highlights companies that think and care about their people.
Apifier
Hosted web crawler for developers.
Is it Pokemon or Big Data
A game to try to recognize if a name belongs to pokemon or to big data. Hilarious.
Let's Encrypt
Finaly it's there, entering public beta this december 3th.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Minuteman
Analytics framework using redis.
Rcon
A lightweight resource virtualization tool for linux processes.
Slate
Beautiful static documentation for APIs.
Rnpm
React Native Package Manager.
sqlmap
Automatic SQL penetration testing tool.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Pascal's Triangle with Ruby's Enumerator nov 30
Generating Pascal's Triangle as an Enumerable sequence with Ruby's Enumerator.
Watch Ruby as it parses your code nov 30
The ruby parser is a kind of a state machine.
Sidekiq as a micorservice message queue nov 30
Splitting out unique microservices using Sidekiq, without a message broker.
Lets Encrypt Everything nov 30
Now that letsencrypt enters in public beta, you should try it out.
Linux Performance Analysis in 60,000 Milliseconds nov 30
You login to a Linux server with a performance issue: what do you check in the first minute?
Immutable Strings in Ruby 2.3 dec 1
Better performance and thread safety on immutable strings.
The Definitive Guide to Ruby Heap Dumps, Part I dec 1
Usage of heap dumps analyze it memory leaks.
Introduction to Refactoring dec 1
One of the most common refactorings is the one known as ‘extract method’.
Ruby Version Usage in Commercial Projects, 2015 Edition dec 1
Once a team has managed to cross the chasm between 1.9.x and Ruby 2, adopting newer versions is relatively easy.
Become a videogame developer master with Gosu and Ruby dec 2
Use Gosu to do a 2D shooting game in Ruby.
Querying with Active Record in Ruby on Rails dec 2
Tutortial about various query methods of Active Record.
Password Strength `meter` dec 2
With the introduction of HTML5, we now have the ability to use the meter element in our markup.
The Fall and Rise of SVG dec 2
Historic retrospective on the SVG evolution.
Why and how to test Rake tasks in your Rails application. dec 3
By integration and unit tests.
Swift is now open source dec 3
Apple open-sources its Swift programming language.
How to Schedule Background Tasks in JavaScript dec 4
Schedule non-essential background tasks during those moments the browser is taking a breather.
Microsoft Edge JavaScript engine to go open-source dec 5
Open-sourcing the core components of Chakra, on Github.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Developing Ruby Applications with Docker (40m) dec 3
Talk by Laura Frank at ArrrrCamp 2015.

item.title: Green Ruby News #147
item.content:encoded:
#147 - nov 29th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Empty states
A collection of designs for empty states.
Sweet Punk
Creative digital agency based in Paris

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
DevOps eBooks and Resources
(books) Resources available for free download for developers, operations, QA and security leaders.
HackerRank
Where hackers hangout to solve interesting Computer Science challenges
Perl 6 Introduction
Your thought (or hoped) it was dead? It's alive again.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
lock_and_cache
Make sure only one process calculates the cache and gain lock to prevent other processes to calculate the cache again on redis.
LoopBack
Highly-extensible, open-source Node.js framework.
Perfect
Server-side Swift.
Kings hand
Tool for organizing ad-hoc shell(ish) scripts.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Building a Slackbot with Ruby and Sinatra nov 23
Make a Slackbot in few steps with Sinatra.
Physical software made easy with Arduino and Ruby on Rails nov 23
Combine web development with IoT.
Creating Node.js Command Line Utilities to Improve Your Workflow nov 23
Brian Rinaldi demonstrates how to use the Vorpal module in Node.js.
Rails Asset Pipeline Simple Guide nov 24
How asset pipeline work and how you can use it with your rails application.
JSON API Apps With Lotus nov 24
Use Lotus gems to build it a json API server.
Rails: How to create a custom PDF renderer plugin nov 24
A detailled tutorial to make render spit out PDF files with prawn.
Peeking Under the Hood of ActionController Parameters, Part 2 nov 24
The next part of last week article.
Is it nil? nov 25
Everything is not nil except itself.
Ruby memory analysis over time nov 25
Time-based approach to debug ruby memory leak.
Know What Your Users Know with Raygun nov 26
How to integrate Raygun into your Rails application and start to track errors in just ten minutes.
Drag and Drop File Uploading nov 27
We can't 100% rely on browsers supporting drag and drop. We should provide a fallback solution.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
RubyConf 2015 - Keynote and Q&A: Matz (1h12) nov 22
Amongst (many) other things about Ruby 3, Matz announced the Ruby 3x3 (@ 54:05), a goal for Ruby 3 to be three times faster than Ruby 2.
Messenger: The (Complete) Story of Method Lookup nov 24
By Jay McGavren at RubyConf 2015.
Reliable Concurrency Without the Actor Model nov 24
This talk was given at Midwest.io 2015.

item.title: Green Ruby News #146
item.content:encoded:
#146 - nov 22th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Buca boot
A simple but good design all on one page.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Empire of code
A new game involving coding.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Nprogress-rails
Slim progress bars for Ajax'y applications.
Godmin
Admin framework for Rails 4+
Sigma js
Publish networks on Web pages.
Multi-Level Menu
Simple multi-level menu with delayed item animations.
Notie.js
A clean and simple notification plugin.
Kong
Open-source, Microservice and API Management Layer built on top of NGINX.
Git-fastclone
git clone --recursive on steroids.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Sidekiq 4.0 is now available nov 16
Benchmarks show a lot of effective optimization.
Lexical scoping and Ruby class variables nov 16
Class variables are confusing. Even expert Ruby users can find them hard to intuit.
Deploying Ruby Apps with Bare Metal: A New Type of VM nov 16
The Bare Metal container platform is a service from CenturyLink, here is how to set up a simple Ruby app there.
Update your gems every Monday morning nov 16
Frequent updates of your gems saves money.
Static Website Generators Reviewed nov 16
Jekyll, Middleman, Roots, Hugo.
The Cost of Frameworks nov 16
Interesting transcription of a talk about how to think about using a framework.
Open Sourcing Statsgod nov 16
A StatsD Implementation In Go.
Why It's Time For Go Packages To Start Versioning nov 16
Please provide semantically versioned releases of your Go packages and libraries.
Anatomy of a Haskell-based Application nov 16
A general overview of what an Haskell application looks like.
Spying on running Ruby processes nov 17
How about injecting code to be executed inside of a running process?
Peeking Under the Hood of ActionController Parameters, Part 1 nov 17
All about the permit method filters.
Instant Loading Web Apps With An Application Shell Architecture nov 17
Diving into Progressive Web Apps (PWA).
Brakeman Pro 1.0 nov 18
Initial release of Brakeman Pro.
Stretchy Navigation in CSS and jQuery nov 18
A rounded navigation trigger that stretches on click/tap to reveal the navigation items
Learn concurrency by implementing futures in Ruby nov 19
Futures are a concurrency abstraction that represents the result of an asynchronous computation.
The many uses of Ruby case statements nov 19
The case statement is more flexible than it might appear at first sigh.
Representable 2.4 nov 19
How Functional Programming Speeds Up Rendering And Parsing.
Getting started with service workers nov 19
There was a time when people only related the use of push notifications to mobile applications. Luckily, that time has passed.

item.title: Green Ruby News #145
item.content:encoded:
#145 - nov 15th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Boldking
Simple and nice usage of illustrations.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
DreamFactory
REST API backend for mobile, web, and IoT applications

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.0-preview1 Released nov 11
Many new features and improvements are included.
Immutable-struct
Create struct-like classes that don't have setters, but have an awesome constructor.
Stitches
Rails Engine and supporting classes for easily exposing a RESTful API.
Rspec_api_documentation
Automatically generate API documentation from RSpec.
Apitome
An API documentation reader (as a rails engine) for RSpec API Documentation.
Descriptive_statistics
Adds methods to the Enumerable module to allow easy calculation of basic descriptive statistics.
Facette
Time series data visualization and graphing software.
Clair
Container Vulnerability Analysis Service.
Helm
The Kubernetes Package Manager.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby DelegateClass nov 8
Composing objects to achieve flexibility and maintain encapsulation.
Slicing and Dicing Ruby Enumerables nov 10
Super-useful methods when you need to group items in an array or other enumerable based on arbitrary criteria.
Methods to Remember Things by: Ruby Memoization nov 10
Another post describing memoization in details.
Six years of Go nov 10
Happy birthday Go.
Hash Comparison in Ruby 2.3 nov 11
New hash comparison methods that will be available in Ruby 2.3 when it's released this coming Christmas.
Snappier Development Mode in Rails 5 nov 11
For a long time Rails simply reloaded unconditionally in every request, this will be changed in Rails 5.
The Sprockets 4 Manifest nov 11
When Rails 5 is released it will require that you upgrade to Sprockets 4.
Search by proximity using PostGIS and Rails nov 11
Try out PostGIS, an addon for PostgreSQL.
The Difference Between Responsive and Adaptive Design nov 11
This is a question that comes up more regularly than you might expect.
Using HTML5’s Native Drag and Drop API nov 11
Hook into native events and attributes to handle drag and drop interactions.
Simple, Clutter-free Programming with Go nov 11
Many of the reasons Go is chosen for large-scale, distributed and network-heavy applications.
Ruby 2.3.0 preview 1 nov 12
Review of did_you_mean.gem, Safe navigation operator and Frozen String Literal Pragma.
Bulletproof Rails Background Jobs nov 12
Few common-sense patterns to keep the back side as neat and well-ordered as the front.
Power Failure Testing with SSDs nov 12
Testing SSD disks and Postgres.
An Overview of JavaScript Templating Engines nov 13
What benefits JavaScript templates can provide.

item.title: Green Ruby News #144
item.content:encoded:
#144 - nov 8th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Wove
Pretty neat website for an interesting device.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rscss
Reasonable system for CSS stylesheet structure.
Ruby-tricks
Ruby tricks.
Brave Clojure
(book) Free online E-book for learning Clojure.
AnyAPI
Documentation and test consoles for over 150 public APIs.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Administrate
An admin dashboard as Rails engine, build by thoughtbot.
Rubycritic
A Ruby code quality reporter.
Namecase
Properly case people's names
Freakonomics
Freakonomics Radio CLI downloader. Nothing exceptional, I just happen to love that podcast.
Ircanywhere
Web based multi-user IRC bouncer.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Elixir is not Ruby nov 1
Differences on all dimensions about Elixir and Ruby.
Blog migration: From Jekyll to Middleman nov 1
Experience of a migration.
Understanding self in Ruby nov 2
Look at self in a variety of every-day situations.
React Native - How to make Instagram nov 2
Full length tutorial on a react native app with gl-react.
How Ruby Interprets and Runs Your Programs nov 3
Using ripper and RubyVM::InstructionSequence to examine and understand how ruby works.
Hunting Down the Scoop on ActiveRecord Scopes nov 3
What was going on under the hood when you use scopes.
Announcing Administrate nov 3
The successor of active-admin.
Naming Colors nov 3
Someone made a mac app to give sensible names to colors.
Using Form Objects in Ruby on Rails nov 4
Tutorial on how to use form objects to lighten models.
Team Collaboration System nov 4
Managing shared resources among developers.
Advanced Data Structures in Ruby nov 5
2 examples of advanced data structure.
How constant lookup and resolution works in Ruby on Rails nov 5
How autoload_paths, require, load, and require_relative works in rails.
Ruby Web Applications Without Rails nov 6
Program in ruby for the web with no framework, just rack.
Reengineer legacy Rails applications nov 7
Regain control of big ball of mud Ruby on Rails applications.

item.title: Green Ruby News #143
item.content:encoded:
#143 - nov 1st 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Your time 4
Interesting reverse scrolldown.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Attack rails
A long review on how to attack rails apps.
Carina
Instant-on Docker containers by Rackspace.
CSS Shapes
It's a candidate recommandation and not implemented everywhere, but seems promising.
Awesome-tw-foss
A curated list of awesome Taiwan open source projects
Room
Another webrtc conferencing platform.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Jekyll 3.0 Released oct 26
Jekyll 3.0 with less dependencies and better performance.
Shrine
File upload toolkit for Ruby.
i18n-tasks
Manage translation and localization with static analysis.
Polo
Creates sample data snapshots so you can work with real world data in development.
Aasm
State machines for Ruby classes (plain Ruby, ActiveRecord, Mongoid, MongoMapper).
Rapporteur
A Rails Engine which provides a customizable status page on your application.
semantic-ui-sass
Semantic UI, converted to Sass and ready to drop into Rails & Compass.
Greenplum
Yet another RDBS for big data.
Ruby Raven
Information about Ruby Conferences on the App Store.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Using conditionals inside Ruby regular expressions oct 26
The Onigmo regex engine make possible to use conditionals inside of your regular expressions.
10 Ruby Tricks to Make Your Code Nearly Perfect oct 26
Some quick tricks, you may know them all already. Or not.
Lets Write Some Bad Ruby oct 26
Some disposable scripts can tolerate really ugly code.
Six cool features of the Git 2.x series oct 26
Git continues to evolves. Here are some of the new stuff.
Deploying Your Docker Rails App oct 27
How to deploy a Docker container quickly and simply to Heroku.
Cool Ruby Regex Tricks oct 27
Neat tricks with regular expressions in ruby.
Develop a mobile game the easy way oct 27
Game frameworks are a great shortcut when it comes to creating mobile games.
Prevent information leaking in Rails oct 28
A simple measure to avoid the back-button cache disclosure.
Stripe vs Braintree: the Ultimate Guide oct 28
Stripe and Braintree in depth comparison by someone that used both in production.
Please, don’t commit commented out code oct 28
Rant about commented code.
Solving Design Anti-Patterns in Ruby: Fix the Factory oct 29
Ruby can take patterns from other languages to make code concise and expressive.
Solving Design Anti-Patterns in Ruby: Fix the Factory oct 29
Alternatives using of one Ruby’s most used constructs: the Module.
ActiveSupport’s #try might not be doing what you think it’s doing oct 30
#try is usually used to paper over nil values. Unfortunately, #try does more than this.
